name: Agriculture
intro: Zakat on agricultural produce is due on crops and fruits that reach the nisab at harvest. It supports the poor and encourages gratitude for Allah's blessings.

evidences.text: ...and give its due [zakah] on the day of its harvest...
On a land irrigated by rain water or by natural water channels or if the land is wet due to a nearby water channel, ush'r (one-tenth) is compulsory...

conditions: Owns crops/fruits that reach the nisab (approx. 653 kg of dates/grains).
Produce is harvested from land owned or managed.
calculation: If irrigated naturally, pay 10% of the harvest. If irrigated artificially, pay 5%.
example: Example: You harvest 1,000 kg of wheat irrigated by rain. Pay 10% = 100 kg as zakat.
madhhabNotes: All schools: Zakat is due at harvest if nisab is reached. Rate depends on irrigation method.

faq.q: What is the nisab for crops?

faq.a: No, only on storable crops/fruits. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/2795/nisab-of-zakaah-in-grams-of-gold-and-silver
